alert.note: Alert for Western Loudoun (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 06 at 3:32PM EDT until May 09 at 7:09PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Baltimore MD/Washington DC has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Maryland... Virginia... Potomac River at Point of Rocks affecting Frederick MD and Western Loudoun zones. For the Potomac River...including Point of Rocks...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING TO MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Potomac River at Point of Rocks. * WHEN...From Sunday morning to Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water approaches structures at the Brunswick campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM EDT Friday the stage was 5.9 feet, or 10.1 feet below flood stage. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Please visit https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety information. && River Name Fld Observed Fri Sat Sat Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 8PM 2AM 8AM Stg Time Date Potomac River Point of Rocks 16.0 5.9 Fri 2 pm 5.6 5.7 6.5 18.4 8pm Sun &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1145 PM EDT.
